name: Hammock Beach Resort

reviews.title: Wow
reviews.text: Did not make any plans ahead And booked this at last second. Awesome fifth floor stay. You would not know this was located in this area unless you knew where you were going. Do not use hotels.com as we did and they screwed it up, hotel on the other hand even had significantly lower rate. Would highly recommend. Stop at the full service public grocery store back out at highway

This is THE place! We stay at a lot of different hotels and resorts and this place is 2nd to none. The staff is awesome, the rooms make you feel like you are in Fiji or some Polynesian island getaway and the amenities are to die for. We truly enjoyed our experience here to the max. (My daughter made me put that). Hot tubs hot, lazy river, lazy, waking up to see the waves breaking on the shore from the Atlantic, awesome! Thank you to Mr. Grant and his staff, our stay was excellent.
reviews.title: WOW!

reviews.text: Stayed here in the summer for 5 days with kids. We all loved it! The resort is beautifull and clean. The rooms are big and comfortable. The only issue we had with air conditioner blowing on us at night. The beach is beautifull and a lot of waves. Be carefull, because there are many rocks in the water. The pool is great and kids loved it very much. It would be nice if they would have some entertainement at night. Overall the resort is great, but not for a long vacation.
reviews.title: Excellent place for family vacation

reviews.text: An hour and twenty minute drive from Jacksonville International Airport either via I-95 or A1A much of which is along the Atlantic coast and you arrive at Hammock Beach Resort. There is not much between St.Augustine to the North and Flagler to the South. Both are destinations to visit. The Flagler Fish Company has the freshest fish(brought in twice daily and cooked in your style). St Augustine has a lot of history and several excellent dining venues.
reviews.title: LUXURY IN THE MIDDLE OF NOWHERE

reviews.text: Now about Hammock Beach Resort, our one bedroom suite on the 7th floor had a great ocean view. The staff at Hammock make your stay most enjoyable and makes up for certain resauants not being opened. Yes there are no ice machines, but we never waited more than 5 minutes. The pools both indoor and outdoor are large and well appointed. The fitness center is huge.
reviews.title: Great for friends vacationing together!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a beautiful resort. We stayed for Labor Day weekend in one of the one bedroom suites. The room was spacious and very clean. You are right on the beach and if salt water isn't your thing, they have a amazing pool area, complete with a lazy river and 3 pools (including an adults only). The only downer is it is a bit away from restaurants (and the food at the hotel is a bit pricey). During our weekend we drive up to St. Augustine from the hotel, only 30 minutes away!
reviews.title: Great Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Found the resort on hotels.com and loved the pictures. Loved to get to play tennis,golf and walk around this secluded resort. The hotel pool areas were never crowded and the cascades were beautiful. The cabanas are very private and we used them everyday. There is an adults only pool and we were the only people there! The best was the views we enjoyed every afternoon and the sunset. The service was great and the food was delicious. We would definitely come back.
reviews.title: Amazing resort!

reviews.text: Nice area...good looking...but when you look deeper...you can find things that are not expected for a 5 star hotel/complex. First issue, floors in our bedroom were almost dirty the whole time we were there. At first look, they seem nice but when we looked under our kids feet each day...one could see the reason why. Second issue, found a cockroach in our bathroom. A sorry was the hotel answer.
reviews.title: Superficial...

reviews.text: Third issue,we are golfers but had young children and wanted to initiate them to putting. The grass of the mini-golf was so long that it was impossible to keep a good line. Moreover, we had to pay for the putter clubs which were dangerous because the two putters were rusty and sharpen (the only left...they told us!)
reviews.title: Nice Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As preferred members, we were thinking that they will be more likely to fulfill our needs but no...They never respond to our complain and/or survey they sent us after!
reviews.title: LOUD PARTY IN THE BANQUET HALL!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for almost a week & loved it. We played golf & I hit the tennis courts. Lots to see & do OR just relax in the pool. The staff is very helpful & happy. The only problem was the closure of the sports bar & a couple of other venues due to private functions, this happened a lot on our stay so we did not get a chance to play pool & hang out in the bar area @ night.
reviews.title: ~**~ Relax & Unwind ~*~ stay for a week..or 2 ....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort is out of town so you would have to take a taxi to go drinking @ the local spots.
reviews.title: Always close to excellent just fall short in certain areas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you’re looking for a place for all the family this is it. There is a separate pool area for adults so you’re not tripping over peoples kids. Food & drink a little on the high price side but very good quality & great service made up for this in a hurry. Yes we will go back, would highly recommend a week or 2 or 3. The long beach is great for walks & the towel service is an added bonus on the beach. The rooms are VERY clean & house keeping does a great job !!
reviews.title: We would go back!

reviews.text: Yes I would tell everyone to try this place out @ least once. We stayed in the Lodge.
reviews.title: Exceptional Hotel and service.

reviews.text: We have been here many times, but it had been a year since our last time. We got an awesome room with a great view on the north side of the main tower.
reviews.title: Wonderful resort

reviews.text: I was actually here for just one night and we stayed over in the condos area. The main building is very nice as well even though we did not stay there.
reviews.title: Great place! Awesome golf

reviews.text: The resort is very well kept and looks in great shape.
reviews.title: Nice home away from home

reviews.text: The golf is awesome, the conservatory is probably the best course I have played on Florida! We went there for the golf, so we loved our stay!
reviews.title: Go for the resort, not the beach!

reviews.text: Definitely recommended for families!
reviews.title: Great for families

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food was good but could be a bit better, everything closes down pretty early so be aware of that!
reviews.title: Not a AAA 4 Diamond Resort

description: Escape to Hammock Beach Resort, a luxury family vacation resort in Palm Coast, Florida with all inclusive getaway packages, magnificent family accommodations, golf courses, dining and spa services.
